FILE COMMANDS.cp -r dir1 dir2: copy dir1 to dir2; create dir2 if itdoesn't exist
FILE COMMANDS.mv file1 file2: rename or move file1 to file2if file2 is an existing directory, moves file1 into  directory file2
FILE COMMANDS.ln -s file link: create symbolic link link to file
FILE COMMANDS.head file: output the first 10 lines of file
FILE COMMANDS.tail file: output the last 10 lines of file
FILE COMMANDS.tail -f file: output the contents of file as it grows, starting with the last 10 lines

PROCESS MANAGEMENT.bg: resume a stopped job in the background
PROCESS MANAGEMENT.fg: brings the most recent job to foreground
PROCESS MANAGEMENT.fg n: brings job n to the foreground

FILE PERMISSIONS.chmod octal file: change the permissions of file to octal, which can be found separately for user, group, and world by adding -> 4 – read (r),2 – write (w),1 – execute (x)
FILE PERMISSIONS.chmod 755: rwx for owner, rx for group and world

SSH.ssh [-p port] user@host: connect to host as user,optionally on custom port port
SSH.ssh-copy-id user@host: add your key to host for user to enable a keyed or passwordless login

SEARCHING.command | grep pattern: search for pattern in the output of command

SYS INFO.date: show the current date and time
SYS INFO.whoami: who you are logged in as
SYS INFO.which app: show which app will be run by default
SYS INFO.type app: show which app or builtin will be run

COMPRESSION.tar cf file.tar files: create a tar named file.tar containing files
COMPRESSION.tar czf file.tar.gz files: create a tar with Gzip compression
COMPRESSION.tar cjf file.tar.bz2: create a tar with Bzip2 compression
COMPRESSION.gzip file: compresses file and renames it to file.gz

NETWORK.Ctrl+Z: stops the current command, resume with fg in the foreground or bg in the background
NETWORK.Ctrl+D: log out of current session, similar to exit
NETWORK.Ctrl+W: erases one word in the current line
NETWORK.Ctrl+R: type to bring up a recent command
